name: strop
content:
strop noun [C]
(STRAP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a strip of leather or other material that you can rub an old-fashioned razor, knife, etc. on in order to make the blade sharp : Use a strop to maintain a sharp edge on your knives and cutting tools. a razor strop
a length of rope, etc., formed into a ring at the end, that is used, for example, for supporting something heavy when it is being moved, or for tying a boat up so that it does not float away: The crane was in position, the strops were on, and the boat was lifted high and then lowered gently onto the waiting low-loader. The mooring strop allows boats to be moored to buoys.
More examplesFewer examplesOther materials can be used but strops are most often made of leather. Once you've learned to sharpen with a stone, it's time to maintain your edge with a strop.This extension was designed to avoid the need to connect a recovery strop to a heavy and dangerous chain.

strop noun [C]
(MOOD)
UK informal a bad mood, especially one in which a person will not do as they are asked and is unpleasant to other people: Don't go in unless you have to - she's in a (real) strop. He's impossible to talk to when he's having one of his strops. When she didn't get what she wanted she threw a strop. have a strop on
to be in a bad mood: Why have you got such a strop on - what's happened?

strop verb
(MAKE SHARP)
[ T ] to make a blade, etc. sharp by rubbing it on a strip of leather or other material: The barber's customers miss the familiar sound of a cut-throat blade being stropped on a leather strap.
More examplesFewer examplesHe stropped a knife razor-sharp on the inside of his belt.He stood stropping a razor as a rhythmic accompaniment to his friend's guitar playing.

strop verb
(BEHAVE ANGRILY)
[ I usually + ADV/PREP ] UK informal to act or go somewhere in a way that shows you are in a bad mood and angry with other people: She muttered goodbye and stropped off home. All he does is strop around with a grumpy face, complaining about everything.
More examplesFewer examplesShe used to strop about like a horrible moody teenager.What did he do if he didn't get his way? He stropped.
